Effect: Create an insect.
Create a tiny living animal.
Stop the progress of a animal's disease.
Heal one wound level of damage in an animal.
Create a small animal.
Create a medium animal. Create a tiny magical beast. Create a swarm of insects. Heal two wound levels of damage. Restore a lost sense. Restore a lost limb. Cure a disease, counteracting its effects.
Create a large living animal. Create a small magical beast. Heal four wound levels of damage.
Create a very large living animal. Create a medium magical beast. Heal six wound levels of damage.
Create a large magical beast. Heal eight wound levels of damage.
Create a very large magical beast. Heal ten wound levels of damage.
Raise an animal from the dead (Ritual).
Get a mental image of an animal.
Sense the state of consciousness of a beast. Get general information about its body.
Sense the dominant drive of a beast. Learn a specific fact about its body.
Learn the origin, age, and history of something made of animal products.
Speak with an animal (Auram requisite for birds, Aquam requisite for fish). Read an animal’s surface thoughts.
Read the recent memories of a beast.
Thoroughly probe the mind of a beast.
Make a superficial change to something made of animal products (like changing its color).

Make a major change to something made of animal products that preserves the substance (for example, turn a leather jerkin into a saddle). Gradually turn meat into vermin. Make a superficial change to a beast.
Change an animal’s limb.
Make a major change in a beast, while leaving it recognizably the same sort of animal (for example, make a horse bigger and change its color).
Change an animal into a different animal. Change an animal in a minor way so that it is no longer natural (for example, change the color of a horse’s coat to match the covenant’s coat of arms).
Change an animal into a human (though it retains its animal mentality and does not gain a soul). Change an animal into a plant (requires an Herbam requisite).
Change an animal in a major unnatural way (for example, give a horse claws, fangs, and scaly armored skin). Change an animal into a non-living item (appropriate requisite required).
Damage something made of animal products.
Do superficial damage to a beast (for example, remove its hair). Destroy something made of animal products.
Cause a beast pain, but do no real damage.
Do 1 wound level of damage. Destroy a beast’s limb.
Destroy one of a beast’s senses. Do 2 wound levels of damage.
Do 4 wound levels of damage.
Kill an animal.
Manipulate items made from animal products.
Plant a single suggestion in the mind of an animal. Protect the target from animal attacks (affects normal animals only).
Calm an animal.
Manipulate an animal’s emotions. Paralyze an animal.
Make an animal completely passive.
Completely control an animal.
Fill a man-made container with water (or some other natural liquid, with appropriate requisites).
Create water (or some other natural liquid) that is not contained (for example, spread over a surface). Create a slightly unnatural liquid.

Create water (or some other natural liquid) in an unnatural shape (for example, in a sphere over someone’s head) or in an unnatural location (like within someone’s lungs)—but water so created will behave normally. Create an extremely unnatural liquid.
Create poison that causes a minor illness.
Create a small spring. Create poison that causes major illness.
Create poison that is fatal.
Get an image of water within range.
Get an images of water and its immediate surroundings within range.
Learn the natural properties of a liquid.
Learn the natural properties of a mixture of liquids.
Learn the magical properties of a liquid. Make your senses unaffected by water.
Learn the magical properties of a mixture of liquids.
Speak with a natural body of water.
Speak with an artificial body of water (like a fountain).
Change a characteristic of liquid within that liquid’s normal range (for example, make water pure or stagnant).
Change a natural liquid into another natural liquid.

Change a liquid into a corresponding solid (Terram requisite) or gas (Auram requisite) (for example, water to ice or steam). Change a natural liquid into a slightly unnatural liquid (for example, make blue water or strawberry flavored castor oil), or vice versa.

Change a liquid into an unrelated solid or gas (with requisites). Change a natural liquid into two or more different natural liquids, with the two types separate (although they will mix again normally). Change a liquid into a very unnatural liquid (for example, a shocking pink liquid that causes bizarre hallucinations)—requisites will often be required.
Change a liquid into a mixture of any liquid, solid (with Terram requisite), or gas (with Auram requisite). Change a liquid into a slightly unnatural solid or gas.
Change a liquid into a very unnatural solid or gas.
Destroy a liquid (requisites may be required).
Destroy one property of a liquid (like alcohol’s ability to intoxicate or sea water’s saltiness).
Destroy a Small spring, so that it never flows again.
Destroy a lake, drying the bed and preventing water from ever naturally pooling there (channels for runoff are also created)--Ritual.
Control a liquid in a natural fashion (for example, control direction or speed of flow).
Control a liquid in a slightly unnatural fashion (for example, make it flow uphill or stop it from wetting something). Control an amount of liquid which is part of a larger body in a natural fashion.

Control a liquid in a highly unnatural fashion (for example, make it flow straight up in the air or take on a humanoid form). Control an amount of liquid which is part of a larger body in a slightly unnatural fashion.
Control an amount of liquid which is part of a larger body in a highly unnatural fashion.
Create a draft.
Create a breeze.
Create a wind. Create a fog.
Create a squall.
Create a thunderstorm.
Create a tempest.
Create a hurricane.
Sense one property of air (for example, determine if it is safe to breathe).
Learn all mundane properties of the air. Have an intuition about some fact regarding the air.
Make your senses unhindered by the air (for example, you can hear over a howling wind).
Predict the weather.
Speak with air.
Double or halve the intensity of a manifestation of air.
Transform an amount of air into another form of air.
Transform an amount of air into another element. Transform an amount of air into a gas that does +5 damage.
Transform an amount of air into a mixture of elements. Transform an amount of air into something slightly unnatural (for example, into silvery fog or a specific shape).
Transform an amount of air into something wholly unnatural (for example, transform a cloud into a horse shape that gallops across the sky).
Destroy an amount of air. Stop very minor weather phenomena, like breezes.
Stop any one part of a weather phenomenon (for example, stop lightning from striking during a thunderstorm).
Stop any weather phenomenon, excluding those caused by Ritual magic.
Control an amount of air.
Control an amount of air with great force.
Direct weather in progress. Control an amount of air with enough force to uproot small trees.
Cause clouds to produce rain. Control an amount of air with enough force to uproot large trees.
Prevent decay of a body.
Create an entire human corpse. Stabilize one wound.
Stop the progress of a disease.
Heal one wound level of damage.
Heal the damage caused by a poison or disease.
Restore a lost limb. Heal two wound levels of damage.
Heal four wound levels of damage.
Heal all harm done to a body.
Return “life” to a corpse (Ritual)—See The Shadow of Life Renewed.
Sense very general information about a body.
Sense a specific piece of information about a body.
Locate a person you have an arcane connection to.
Sense all useful information about a body.
Speak with a dead body.
Change a small part of a person (for example, an eye or nose).
Change a limb of a person.
Change the face of a person.
Utterly change the appearance or size of a person (though they must still remain human in form). Make a body resistant to damage (+1D+2 Soak).
Turn a human into a land animal (with an Animál requisite).
Make body resistant to damage (+3D+1 Soak).
Turn a human into a bird or a fish (Animál requisite).
Turn a human into a solid inanimate object (Terram requisite). Turn a human into a plant (Herbam requisite).
Turn a human into an insubstantial object (Auram requisite).
Do superficial damage to a body (for example, remove its hair).
Cause a person pain, but do no real damage. Cause the loss of one Fatigue level.
Do one wound level of damage to a person. Destroy a person’s limb. Destroy a corpse.
Destroy one of a person’s major senses. Do two wound levels of damage.
Age someone five years. Do three wound levels of damage.
Inflict a major disease. Do four wound levels of damage.
Kill a person.
Make a target lose control of a body part.
Control the large-scale physical movements of a target.
Hold a target’s the body motionless.
Control a target’s motions. Eliminate the penalties of wounds.
Direct the flow of bodily energy.
Teleport a target’s body to a place you have an arcane connection to. Teleport a target’s body seven leagues.
Create a plant product (like a fruit or leaf). Create a plant. Prevent a plant from becoming sick.
Create a bush or a pile of sticks or brambles. Prevent a bush from becoming sick.
Create a tree. Create wood. Prevent a tree from becoming sick. Prevent wood from rotting.
Gain an intuitive knowledge of a plant (for example, know whether a given action would harm a plant).
Learn general information, or a single specific fact about a plant or an item made from plant products.
Learn all mundane properties of a plant or an item made from plant products.
Sense or locate plants you cannot otherwise perceive.
Speak with a plant.
Change a plant or item made from plant products.
Change a plant or item made from plant products into metal or stone (Terram requisite).
Cause a plant to bend or twist rapidly in place.
Affect the consciousness and spirit of a plant.
Spoil an amount of food.
Destroy an amount of dead wood. Cause the leaves to fall off of a plant.
Destroy a plant.
Control an amount of wood (for example, a branch or a wooden weapon).
Deflect a single attack by a wooden weapon.
Deflect several attacks by wooden weapons.

Deflect all known attacks by wooden weapons. Cause a Small amount of wood (for example, a wooden weapon, small plant, or branch) to move around as you direct it, though if it is a rooted plant, it remains rooted.

Deflect all attacks by wooden weapons, both seen and unseen. Cause a Small amount of wood (for example, a wooden weapon, small plant, or branch) to move around as you direct it (it need not remain rooted).
Ignite something extremely flammable (like oil or a wick). Illuminate an area as if by moonlight. Heat an object so that it is warm to the touch.
Ignite something very flammable (like parchment). Illuminate an area as if by candlelight. Heat an object to be hot to the touch.

Create a fire intense enough to do 1D+2 damage (a Small flame can only affect a single target). Ignite something flammable (like dry wood or charcoal). Illuminate an area as if by torchlight. Heat an object enough to boil water.

Create a fire doing 1D+2 damage in an unnatural shape (like a ring or sheet). Create a fire doing 3D+1 damage. Ignite something slightly flammable (like damp wood or leather). Illuminate an area as if by daylight on a cloudy day. Heat an object enough to make it glow red-hot.

Create a fire doing 3D+1 damage in an unnatural shape. Create a fire doing 5D damage. Ignite something barely flammable (like a human body). Illuminate an area as if by full sunlight. Heat an object enough to melt lead.
Create a fire doing 6D+2 damage. Heat an object enough to melt steel.
Create a fire doing 8D+1 damage.
Create a fire doing 10D damage.
Sense one property of a fire. Locate a fire.
Sense all mundane properties of a fire. Become aware of all fires within the target area. See a fire with which you have an arcane connection.
Sense all mundane properties of ash. See a fire you have an arcane connection to and all things it illuminates (for example, see a campfire and everything within its circle of light).
See clearly through raging fire (an Auram requisite may be necessary if smoke is present as well). Learn the magical properties of a fire.
Speak with a fire.
Change a fire so that it is slightly unnatural (for example, make the flames colored, or make the smoke smell of roses). May require requisites.
Change a fire so that it is completely unnatural (for example, multicolored flames that form images while the popping of the fire plays music). Often requires requisites.
Change a fire into natural air (Auram requisite).
Change a fire into a natural solid (Terram requisite). Change a fire into slightly unnatural air.
Change a fire into a natural liquid (Aquam requisite). Change a fire into very unnatural air.
Greatly reduce the amount of light in an area.
Completely extinguish all light in an area.
Extinguish a fire, cooling the ashes to merely warm. Chill an object.
Strongly chill an object. Destroy one aspect of a fire (for example, heat or light).
Control a fire in a natural fashion (for example, control its direction of spread).
Control a fire in a slightly unnatural fashion (for example, stop it from burning a person).
Control a fire in a very unnatural fashion (for example, fashion into a dancing humanoid shape).
Create an image that affects a single sense.
Create an image that affects two senses.
Create an image that affects three senses.
Create an image that affects four senses.
Create an image that affects five senses.
Use one sense at a distance. Memorize or perfect your memory about an image you have encountered. Be able to discern your own false images.
Use two senses at a distance.
Use three senses at a distance.
Use four senses at a distance. See up to five years into the past.
Use all senses at a distance.
Heighten or lessen one sensation of an object (for example, make a candy more sweet or less sweet).
Change one sensation of an object (for example, make a leaf look like a coin), but not its type.
Change two sensations of an object.
Change three sensations of an object.
Change four sensations of an object.
Change an object completely, in all things except touch.
Completely distort the sensory perceptions of a target.
Destroy an object’s ability to affect a single sense.
Destroy an object’s ability to affect two senses.
Destroy an object’s ability to affect three senses.
Destroy an object’s ability to affect four senses.
Destroy an object’s ability to affect five senses.
Make an object appear (to one sense) to be up to one pace away from its actual position.
Make an object appear (to one sense) to be up to five paces away from its actual position.

Make an object appear (to one sense) to be up to in Near range of its actual position. Make an object appear (to one sense) to be contained in or attached to another object defined at the time of casting (for example, make someone’s voice appear to come from within a bag).
Make an object appear (to one sense) to be in Far range of its actual position.
Make an object appear (to one sense) to be in Sight of its actual position.
Make an object appear (to one sense) to be in a location that the caster has an arcane connection to.
Form words in another’s mind.
Put a thought into another’s mind.
Create an emotion in another’s mind.
Create a memory in another’s mind.
Effectively increase another person’s ability to think.
Sense the state of consciousness of one intelligent being (for example, asleep, awake, meditating, dead, drugged, insane, or comatose).
Sense a single emotion in a being.
Sense all of the emotions in a being. Discover the truth of a statement.
Speak with any one human. Read a person’s surface thoughts. Pick a single answer from the mind of a target.
Read the last day’s memories from one person.
Learn all the information you wish from a person’s mind.
Force a ghost to become visible (provided that it can do so normally).
Make a minor change in a person’s memory of an event.
Make a major change to a person’s memory of an event. Make a minor change to a person’s emotion.
Make a major change to a person’s memory of a series of events. Make a major change to a person’s emotion.
Make major changes to a person’s memory of a period of his life. Completely change a person’s emotions.
Completely rewrite a person’s memories. Utterly change a person’s mind.
Remove a minor detail from a person’s memory.
Remove an important detail from a person’s memory.
Quell an emotion in a person. Diminish a single mental capability in a person.
Remove a minor or short memory from a person’s mind.
Remove a major or long memory from a person’s mind. Reduce all of a person’s mental capabilities.
Remove all emotions from a person. Drive a person insane.
Leaves a person a mindless husk.
Control a target’s mental state (for example, awake, asleep, or confused)
Control a natural emotion (for example, calm, fear). The target must feel the emotion before you can control it.
Control an unnatural emotion (for example, cultivate a person’s feelings of bravery where he is usually cowardly).
Control a human being as long as you can see him.
Give a person one complex command, which he tries to carry out to the best of his ability.
Completely control a person’s mind and emotions.
Create an amount of sand, dirt, mud, or clay.
Create an amount of stone or glass.
Create an amount of metal or a rough gemstone.
Create an amount of polished gemstone.
Learn one mundane property of an object. See an object and its surroundings.
Learn all components of a mixture or alloy (you must know the components before divining the properties).
Learn all the natural properties of an object.
Sense all the mundane properties of a composite object.
Learn the magical properties of an object. Make your senses unhindered by earth (for example, see right through a rock).
Speak with a natural rock (for example, a boulder).
Speak with an artificial rock (for example, a statue).
See an object and its surroundings in the past.
Change one property of dirt.
Change dirt to another type of natural earth (for example, sand to loam).
Change dirt so that it is slightly unnatural (requisites may be required). Change dirt into a liquid or gas (with requisites). Change dirt to stone, or vice versa.
Change dirt so that it is highly unnatural (requisites will often be required). Change dirt into a mixture of liquids, solids, and gases (with requisites).
Change dirt into a slightly unnatural liquid or gas (with requisites).
Change dirt into a highly unnatural liquid or gas (with requisites).
Destroy one property of dirt.
Destroy dirt.
Control or move dirt.
Deflect a single attack by a metal weapon.
Teleport dirt up to 15 paces. Deflect several attacks from metal weapons.
Deflect all metal weapon attacks against you that you are aware of.
Keep metal objects completely away from your person (that is, deflect all attacks against you from metal weapons, whether you are aware of them or not).
Create magical shell against Intelligo spells.
Detect magical spells and effects.
Change a magical spell or effect.
Dispel magic. Mask magic. Harm magical creatures.
Sustain a spell. Ward against spells, effects, or magical creatures. Grant magic resistance. Open a mystical conduit.
